title: Green turtles released in Far North for groundbreaking research
text:
The gentle splash of flippers signalled a new chapter for five green turtles that were released back into the wild in Rangaunu Harbour in the Far North.
The release marks the beginning of an important three-year research project, as two of the turtles have been satellite tagged as part of a groundbreaking research project to protect these taonga of the ocean.
The study is part of a collaborative effort led by the Department of Conservation (DoC) in partnership with iwi, and with support from Auckland Zoo and Sea Life Kelly Tarlton‚Äôs Aquarium. The aim is to tag up to 20 turtles over the next three years.
It is the beginning of the largest satellite tagging study undertaken for green turtles in New Zealand and will inform experts about where the turtles go and when.
DoC marine senior science adviser Dr Karen Middlemiss, who is leading the research, was grateful to be working alongside iwi.

title: Azerbaijan hosting COP29 brings significant benefits for Pakistan - Qaiser Nawab
text:
ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, July 12. The hosting of
COP29 in Azerbaijan opens up significant opportunities for
Pakistan, Qaiser Nawab, President of the Belt and Road Initiative
for Sustainable Development, told
Trend.
"COP29 is not only an opportunity but also a global responsibility. We are proud that Azerbaijan will host the event because, as close brothers, we see Azerbaijan's success as our success. Hosting COP29 in Azerbaijan is a great opportunity for Pakistan as well. We can leverage this opportunity more effectively," he said.
Nawab noted that Pakistan has recently been severely impacted by climate change and environmental degradation.
"Heat waves pose a challenge to food security, and excessive rainfall is causing flooding issues. Millions of people are homeless, and many children cannot attend school. I believe Pakistan can use this platform very effectively. When COP29 President Mukhtar Babayev visited Pakistan, I had the opportunity to meet him and discuss what the youth of Pakistan think about this and how we can involve young people in this process," he said.
Nawab stated that Mukhtar Babayev assured him there will be ample opportunity for young people to discuss climate change and demonstrate their support for this global cause.
"We expect many young people from Pakistan to come to Azerbaijan to speak about our problems to the world community at COP29," he added.
Furthermore, Nawab noted that relations between the two countries are based on mutual trust, understanding, cultural similarity, and brotherhood.
"Why not utilize this mutual brotherhood to increase trade turnover to several millions and billions," he said.
The 29th session of the Conference of the Parties to the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (COP29) will be held in Azerbaijan in November this year. The decision was made at the plenary meeting of COP28 held in Dubai on December 11 last year. Within two weeks Baku, having become the center of the world, will host about 70,000-80,000 foreign guests.
The UN Framework Convention on Climate Change is an agreement signed at the Rio Earth Summit in June 1992 to prevent dangerous human interference in the climate system. The acronym COP (Conference of Parties) stands for Conference of Parties, which is the highest legislative body overseeing the implementation of the Framework Convention on Climate Change.
A total of 198 countries are parties to the convention. Unless the parties have decided otherwise, COP is held annually. The first COP event was held in March 1995 in Berlin, and its secretariat is located in Bonn.

title: Los sindicatos alertan del "preocupante" aumento de agresiones a profesores en Castilla-La Mancha
text:
El Sindicato de Trabajadoras y Trabajadores de la Ense√±anza de Castilla-La Mancha (STE-CLM) ha hecho balance del curso escolar 2024-2025, y han llegado a la conclusi√≥n de que la Consejer√≠a de Educaci√≥n suspende el curso por su ‚Äúinacci√≥n‚Äù ante los grandes retos del sistema educativo p√∫blico regional. Uno de los problemas m√°s graves se√±alados por STE-CLM es el aumento de agresiones f√≠sicas al profesorado, con casos destacados como el sucedido en el CEIP Rosa Parks de Toledo . Para la organizaci√≥n sindical, estos episodios son s√≠ntomas de un deterioro estructural que afecta a todo el sistema, caracterizado por una sobrecarga laboral constante, la falta de apoyo institucional, la precariedad laboral y la p√©rdida de respeto hacia el profesorado.
Durante la rueda de prensa ofrecida en su sede en Toledo, el sindicato ha presentado un informe de una encuesta realizada entre m√°s de 1.000 docentes de Castilla-La Mancha para dar visibilidad a la grave situaci√≥n que muchos viven cada d√≠a en las aulas, en lo que respecta a violencia, insultos y menosprecios. En este sentido, los resultados reflejan que un 87 % ha recibido alguna agresi√≥n verbal o f√≠sica por parte de alumnado y/o familias.
Por su parte, el 96 % del profesorado considera muy insuficiente la protecci√≥n y apoyo por parte de la Administraci√≥n educativa, mientras que el 92 % considera que su labor como docente est√° muy poco valorada.
Para la organizaci√≥n sindical, esto afecta a todo el sistema educativo, y han se√±alado que para mejorar la convivencia en los centros educativos es necesario ‚Äúmayor protecci√≥n y apoyo por la Administraci√≥n, mayor respeto por parte del alumnado y las familias, as√≠ como la bajada de ratios en las aulas, disminuci√≥n de la burocracia y aumento de recursos para mejorar la Educaci√≥n P√∫blica‚Äù.
Suspenso en todos los criterios de evaluaci√≥n El sindicato ha calificado como ‚Äúfracaso de la Consejer√≠a‚Äù por no revertir los recortes educativos heredados desde 2010, a pesar de contar con presupuestos ‚Äúmucho mayores que entonces‚Äù.
Uno de los ejemplos que han puesto ha sido la negativa a recuperar el pago del verano para el profesorado interino con m√°s de 5,5 meses trabajados, as√≠ como la falta de voluntad para reimplantar la reducci√≥n lectiva para docentes mayores de 55 a√±os. ‚ÄúActualmente, m√°s de la mitad de la plantilla se encuentra en el RGSS, y no en Clases Pasivas, por lo que se jubilar√° a los 67 a√±os. Seguimos sin medidas que dignifiquen el tramo final de la carrera docente‚Äù, han resaltado.
Otra de las preocupaciones que han destacado ha sido el retroceso en la inclusi√≥n educativa, a pesar de que el alumnado con necesidades espec√≠ficas (ACNEAE) ha aumentado un 281 % en las √∫ltimas dos d√©cadas.
‚ÄúNo hay recursos suficientes, se limitan los apoyos en Infantil, las ratios para orientadores son insuficientes y se ignoran especialidades imprescindibles como Audici√≥n y Lenguaje y Pedagog√≠a Terap√©utica‚Äù, han se√±alado.
Por otra parte, desde el sindicato denuncian que parte de las medidas que se han conseguido, se est√°n financiando con m√°s recortes, cre√°ndose un c√≠rculo vicioso, ‚Äúse est√° desmantelando el bachillerato nocturno, la educaci√≥n de adultos y las escuelas oficiales de idiomas‚Äù.
Castilla-La Mancha, la √∫ltima en la cola Este curso ha estado marcado por movilizaciones generalizadas en todo el Estado. En Castilla-La Mancha, STE-CLM ha liderado varias acciones clave, incluyendo concentraciones, una manifestaci√≥n regional el 28 de mayo y una jornada de huelga el 11 de septiembre.
Por otro lado, el sindicato tambi√©n ha hablado sobre el abandono de zonas tensionadas como La Sagra, el Corredor del Henares, Oca√±a y Taranc√≥n, donde el crecimiento poblacional, la falta de inversi√≥n y la masificaci√≥n en las aulas ‚Äúdificultan cualquier posibilidad real de inclusi√≥n‚Äù.
Respecto a la situaci√≥n de los docentes, STE-CLM ha vuelto a denunciar la p√©rdida de poder adquisitivo del profesorado. ‚ÄúDesde 2010 hasta 2024, el IPC ha subido un 36,1%. Por contra los salarios docentes apenas han aumentado un 16 %, mientras en el sector privado dicho aumento alcanza el 30 %‚Äù, han asegurado desde el sindicato.
Consecuencias del malestar docente Por su parte, la organizaci√≥n sindical ha puesto especial √©nfasis en el creciente desprestigio de la profesi√≥n docente. ‚ÄúEl estr√©s, la ansiedad y la desmotivaci√≥n est√°n provocando que muchos docentes abandonen la profesi√≥n. Se les exige actuar como psic√≥logos, mediadores y especialistas en TIC, pero sin reconocimiento ni respeto‚Äù, han declarado. En palabras de los representantes de STE-CLM, ‚Äúel sistema no puede sostenerse a costa del sobreesfuerzo y la salud de quienes lo mantienen en pie‚Äù.
Un suspenso con consecuencias Desde STE-CLM han hecho hincapi√© en que la situaci√≥n en los centros educativos es ‚Äúun reflejo de los retos que enfrentar√° la sociedad del futuro‚Äù, y han a√±adido que ‚Äúpor ahora, no se est√° superando la prueba‚Äù.
El sindicato STE Castilla-La Mancha denuncia el ‚Äúcalor extremo‚Äù en las aulas y exige un plan de rehabilitaci√≥n energ√©tica
El sindicato ha indicado que la responsabilidad recae en el Gobierno regional y en la Consejer√≠a de Educaci√≥n, Cultura y Deportes. ‚ÄúNo podemos otorgarle un aprobado y le recordamos que, para recuperar el curso, es imprescindible cumplir con todos los criterios de evaluaci√≥n. La comunidad educativa no aceptar√° m√°s excusas ni intentos de maquillar la realidad‚Äù, han concluido.

¬øEn qu√© a√±os se desarroll√≥ la vacuna contra la malaria? Desde 1984, Patarrayo fue el primer director del Instituto de Inmunolog√≠a del hospital San Juan de Dios de Bogot√°. All√≠ desarroll√≥ entre 1986 y 1988 su vacuna SPf66 contra la malaria, la primera en ser reconocida por la OMS.
"Sus aportes y legado en la inmunolog√≠a ser√°n siempre recordados, as√≠ como su ingenio, entusiasmo y dedicaci√≥n por la investigaci√≥n y la ciencia", asegur√≥ en un comunicado difundido en X la facultad de medicina de la Universidad Nacional de Colombia, a la que estuvo vinculado por m√°s de 50 a√±os.
La vacuna de Patarroyo contra la malaria ya no se usa por su poca efectividad, pero en su momento fue revolucionaria.
El cient√≠fico fue blanco de cr√≠ticas de animalistas y de investigaciones judiciales por el uso de micos de la Amazon√≠a para probar la efectividad de la inyecci√≥n.

author: Nicole Tung
title: ‚ÄòIt‚Äôs a way of life‚Äô: Women make their mark in the Ukrainian army - The Boston Globe
text:
On the front line just outside Bakhmut, Ukraine, a 32-year-old commander of a Ukrainian artillery platoon rocked to and fro in the passenger seat of a beat-up Lada, as another soldier navigated the car through a thick forest, sometimes mowing down young trees. When they reached their destination, a small village less than two miles from Russian lines, all that was left were destroyed houses, their shattered roofs visible in the moonlight.
The commander, a female soldier who uses the call sign Witch, is a former lawyer who, along with two of her brothers and her mother, joined the military the day after Russia invaded in February 2022. Her first experience in combat was in the outskirts of Kyiv that year, and much of what she has learned about weapons systems since has been self-taught and on the fly.
Advertisement
Since early 2023, Witch has been with her platoon in the 241st Brigade in the area around Bakhmut, supervising all of the artillery systems. She is resolute about staying in the military even if the war ends. ‚ÄúPeople who want to join the armed forces must understand that it‚Äôs a way of life,‚Äù she said.
As Ukraine struggles against fierce Russian assaults and its losses mount, there has been a surge of women who have enlisted, and they are increasingly volunteering for combat roles. The Ukrainian military has also made a concerted effort to recruit more women to fill its ranks.
About 65,000 women are serving in the Ukrainian armed forces, about a 30 percent increase since the war began. Roughly 45,000 serve as military personnel, and the rest hold civilian positions, according to the Defense Ministry. Just over 4,000 are in combat positions.
Unlike for Ukrainian men, there is no mandatory draft for women; however, women who have medical or pharmaceutical degrees must register for the service.
Advertisement
These women fill a growing number of positions in the military: combat medics in assault units; senior gunners; snipers; commanders of tank units and artillery batteries; and at least one co-pilot on a medevac team who dreams of becoming Ukraine‚Äôs first female helicopter combat pilot. Dozens have been wounded in battle, and some have been killed or captured.
Along the front line, they operate under the same blanket of fear and hardship as male soldiers. In the dank, fortified shelter where Witch and one of her mortar teams spent most of their days, they waited in near darkness in the basement. Turning on lights would mean the crew could not quickly adjust their eyes to the dark if they had to go out and fire.
Witch, speaking with fellow Ukrainian soldiers at an artillery position near Bakhmut, in the Donetsk region of Ukraine. NICOLE TUNG/NYT Farther north, a commander with the call sign Tesla, a former Ukrainian folk singer, sat hunched on a stool in the bare house serving as the field headquarters for the 32nd Mechanized Brigade. Russian forces in the Kupiansk region were sending barrages of artillery raining down on Ukrainian lines.
Tesla was simultaneously sending texts and voice notes to the soldiers in her unit while speaking to the second-in-command about the battlefield plan. Her oversized pants were rolled up, revealing neon orange socks with cartoon avocados on them.
She was trying to redirect Russian fire on a different battalion to her own soldiers‚Äô position, so that the other unit could evacuate a comrade who had been badly wounded. ‚ÄúThree tourniquets on three different limbs,‚Äù came the information on a voice message, she said.
Advertisement
‚ÄúSend one more,‚Äù Tesla ordered over a voice note, giving the command to her soldiers to fire again. ‚ÄúWhen you finish, inform me.‚Äù
Shortly after a Russian assault began in October, overwhelming Ukrainian lines, 24 of her soldiers trained in artillery were ordered to reinforce the infantry troops, which are closest to Russian lines. Tesla spoke to them before they deployed, feeling helpless.
‚ÄúThe worst thing is that I instructed them on completely different things in artillery, and then they get sent to the infantry,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúAnd, imagine, they‚Äôre standing there looking at you as their commander, knowing that they will be sent into the worst possible situation.‚Äù
Tesla, the commander of a Ukrainian artillery battery, spoke with fellow soldiers in a bare house serving as the field headquarters for the 32nd Mechanized Brigade, in the Kharkiv region of Ukraine at the end of October. NICOLE TUNG/NYT Of the 24 sent forward, 15 were wounded, Tesla said, and one was captured in the fighting. The incident stayed on Tesla‚Äôs conscience, but she kept her worries to herself. Her mother still did not know that Tesla was leading an artillery battery, thinking her daughter was working as an instructor at an academy, a safe distance from the front.
Until 2018, women were prohibited from holding combat positions in the Ukrainian military, though a few ignored the rules. The enlistment of thousands more female service members in the military has largely been seen as a welcome step for the country, whose bids to join NATO and the European Union are still under review.
The downside is that the military has not been able to adapt quickly enough to accommodate them. Female soldiers say there is still a dire lack of women‚Äôs fatigues and boots, correctly fitted body armor, and feminine hygiene products. That leaves women to acquire many items on their own.
Advertisement
But the problems go deeper, into issues of gender-based inequality and discrimination.
Many women serving in combat roles said that male soldiers and direct superiors largely did not discriminate by gender ‚Äî though there are still sexual innuendoes and inappropriate comments.
Rather, it is senior commanders, often holdovers from the Soviet-era, who look down on women in the military, especially those in combat roles. In some cases, women are choosing to join newly formed brigades with younger, more dynamic commanders.
‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt want to join a brigade that was established many years ago because I knew they wouldn‚Äôt listen to me as a young officer, and as a woman,‚Äù Tesla said.
Claims of sexual harassment have also surfaced. According to some women, there have been no official channels for reporting harassment other than to battalion commanders, who then have to decide whether to follow up. In some cases, female soldiers said, witnesses may decline to testify for fear of repercussions.
Back in the basement, Witch took a call from the command post: It was time to fire. The team scrambled into a partly covered yard a few feet away where a mortar barrel was readied.
A silence descended as Kuzya, 20, a senior gunner with the mortar platoon, looked through the scope and read out the coordinates on her phone. ‚ÄúFire!‚Äù someone called out. Several more rounds were sent off before the team scrambled back into the basement, awaiting a potential return from the Russians.

author: @abekanan
title: Happy 100th Marris! - ATS - 1.16.24 | 94 Rock | Abe
text:
This is just a small taste of the show overall, the bits and bobs that I found interesting, funny, insightful and relevant. To hear everything that happened, check out the podcast of today's show. However, if you're looking for a quick read along with random self inserts and my personal thoughts, you've come to the right place.
Call in Point :
(This is the broadstroke canvas on which I base my call, obviously these notes are going to be longer and more detailed.)
Yes, it's cold, it's awful, we are in that deep frigid hell that is usually reserved for February but it is what it is, right? I mean, it could be worse but unlike Angi "The Jinx" Taylor, I won't mention aloud all the other things that could be going wrong. Instead, let's turn all the bits of energy we have into effort to ponder an answer to the Daily Discussion Topic. Social media has once again churned out a classic question and we always love to give our two cents on those things. This one concerns red flags and though we usually figure them in conjunction with people, today we're looking at the houses that hold those red flag people. The humble abode is a sanctuary for the most part but today we're taking it to the cleaners. We wanted to hear about what red flags exist the moment you enter someone's house. Marris was up first and offered smells and scents that sent him. Food is one thing but he's talking about raw sewage and wet ass. HP said if she sees a cat, dog or iguana in the kitchen, the food offerings are ignored and that person is probably getting left on read for good. Prison Tattoo coyly explained how you walk into a person's house and see a pic of their wife and kids (preach sister.) Angi added hers last coming for guys who have posters of hot girls, neon beer signs, crates for furniture and a collection of bras nailed to the wall (oddly specific.) She then told the classic story of the time she went to a guy's house and he had stacks on stacks of Asian porn on DVD in his kitchen. I mean, sure she still banged him and the sex was great but at least put that stuff away! Mine would have to be when you go to their place and when you open the trunk to fetch something, there's an axe in it (this is a story but we don't have that kind of time.) Other examples given by social media people included pets not being cared for properly, animals in the house that should not be (squirrels, raccoons, rats, pigeons ... wait,) no hand soap or hand towels in the bathroom, a dirty toilet, trash piled up beyond the trash can, add in hoarding for good measure, unsecured guns lying around, guns mounted on the wall and of course, Live Laugh Love signs. Right then, it's cold so let's keep this moving along with the roadies from the Request Line. Kate was dating a guy and she went into his bathroom to see that it was not only carpeted but also covered in stains (every flag Kate, every single one.) Mike went to a house where there were pictures of the exes on the wall. What should be done is they should be tucked away in a box, in a safe where your husband won't find them and kill you like Angi's. Nick said a distinct smell of no one showering that is a mix of rotten bacon and BO. Pamela said ants, not just a few that you can't control but lines of them moving through the house in unison. Jamie said fly strips everywhere, especially in the kitchen. Donna said signs that another woman lives there. Don the Storyteller went on a date and found a condom in the toilet. If you are looking for more roadie thoughts or have your own, hit up our Facebook group (Angi Taylor Show) and drop us a comment.
Other Stuff from Today's Show :
So, today was a big momentous gigantic and amazing day. I mean sure it's below zero outside and Marris had his car towed this weekend but buried in that mess is a few wins for our boy. First off, today is Marris' 100th show and personally, we could not be happier to have him help steer this mess of a show sometimes. Here's to 100, 200 and 10,496 more (I don't do math, I pulled a random number.) This was on top of riding high from the Lions winning so he was having a good time. That all came crashing down though when he left to go to his car and everything was roped off. Apparently there had been a shooting so no one was allowed around or near where his car was. He attempted to walk around the block but that was taped off as well so he ended up having to crash at a friend's place. Angi, of course, had to inquire if the friend was female. Not only was she but she is also a co-worker. So yes, Marris did sleep at a female co-workers house but HR does not need to be involved as he just rode the couch (as opposed to getting ridden on the couch.) After leaving in the morning, he braved the Hoth like temps to grab his car and that was when the horrifying realization set into his probably frozen brows. If you don't get your car after the final amount you're allowed to shove into the parking meter app, the car gets towed. So not only was he in Lower Wacker but he also had to deal with having his car towed. It ended up costing him $175 to get it back but at least there wasn't a secondary ticket attached due to the shooting. This is basically the way the universe maintains balance, you get some nice things but they are immediately diminished by life slapping you right back in the face.
Because it's cold out, some of us might be considering offering up some life points to the devil today to bring back that incredible warmth we had in December. Though he's not currently dealing in sunshine, another social media polling offered something better than heat, cold hard cash. People were asked if they would trade a year of their life to the devil for $500,000 and if so, how many would they offer up. It should be noted that the years are shaved off at the end of a lifespan and are not cherry picked from here and there. Another caveat is you don't know when you are going to die so you have to go into the choice blind. Marris said he would give up 2 because he could make that cool million work. Angi said that she wouldn't give up any because life is precious. Prison Tattoo added that money is precious as well which is true. Speaking of which, he and HP both said they would give up five years. The thing is, both of them are young and it feels like there is more YOLO to play with. Prison explained that if he was going to make 80 but got cut off at 75, that was good enough and he'd have $2,500,000 to play with up until then. My thought would be giving up 1 because I could make that money last and losing a year isn't too bad imo. Angi showcased that if you were like 70, you would want to save those years. After all, the older generation lost a ton of years during covid and those were not years to give. Back to those polled though, the most common choice was 1 to 2 years being offered up. 18% of those polled though offered 3-4, another 18% said they would follow Angi into no deal. Crazy though was the 15% who said they would give 9 or more. In this instance, you take the money and party with cocaine, hookers, Jay-Z, Tom Brady and a nice big yacht because then you definitely need to live like you're dying.
Finally, here's some unspoken office rules that should never be broken (because that's what you need on a cold Tuesday, a list.)
- When the boss says "alright, anything else?" at the end of a meeting, you keep that mouth shut. Not here at iHeart of course, when a person on this station has to add 20 other things in at the meeting end and everyone needs to get their corny jokes in.
- Don't be too efficient. If you are, you will be asked to do more.
- Walking by a person for a third time in a day, you don't need to say "hello." First time a "hi," the second time a nod and the third, leave them the hell alone.
- Never reheat something smelly, like fish. Marris tends to always get blamed for microwave smells.
- Don't leave a coffee mug in the kitchen. If you do, it becomes communal.
- Don't be smelly at work. This goes for BO, cologne and perfume oversaturation.
- Don't be on the speaker phone at work. No one wants to hear your conversation.
- Don't mess with other people's stuff. Stay out of their lockers and desks.
- Don't schedule meetings the first thing Monday morning or as the last thing on a Friday.
Request Wars 3.0
Current Champion: Angi (1x)
Angi's Song Choice: ‚ÄúBoys of Summer‚Äù by The Ataris
Marris' Song Choice: "Careless Whisper" by Seether
Winner: Angi
10 O' Clock Toast :
Toastee(s): Everyone working outside today & Rob the Truck Driver
It is cold as hell out there today so if you're out, please be safe. That said, a super special shout out to roadie Rob the Truck Driver who heard about roadie Ryan the Truck Driver freezing on 355 after his truck broke down and his boss went to breakfast at Cracker Barrel or something, he came through and helped warm Ryan up. Roadies helping roadies, you love to see it.
Show Quotes and Tidbits :
"And to (Ryan's) bitch ass boss, go F yourself!" - Angi

author: Luis M. Alonso / M. S. Su√°rez Lafuente / Luis Mu√±iz
title: Quince libros reunidos por nuestros cr√≠ticos para despedir 2023
text:
Revoltijo para despedir un a√±o de lecturas
La hermosa y definitiva novela de Maggie O‚ÄôFarrell que recrea el Renacimiento; los cuentos completos de Salter; la obra de ficci√≥n hist√≥rica de Scurati; Geoff Dyer, en un retrato l√∫cido sobre el ocaso de las vidas, y un reportaje √≠ntimo de Arcadi Espada sobre la juventud de la democracia espa√±ola
Luis Mar√≠a Alonso
En "El retrato de casada", Maggie O‚ÄôFarrell (Coleraine, 1972) narra la breve y desdichada vida de Lucrezia de‚Äô Medici, desde su nacimiento en Florencia y su educaci√≥n en la corte de su padre, hasta el matrimonio forzado con el pudiente Alfonso, una uni√≥n que en principio parece ofrecer libertad y que poco a poco se revela como una trampa siniestra y espantosa. Es precisamente el retrato de matrimonio que el duque de Ferrara encarga para su novia el que pone de manifiesto el deseo de controlar no solo lo que ella hace, sino tambi√©n qui√©n es. Elige su vestido, sus joyas y accesorios, sus poses. El duque solo ve en √©l lo que quiere: la transformaci√≥n de la mujer que piensa y siente en un s√≠mbolo m√°s de su poder, otro hermoso objeto para la colecci√≥n. Al mostrarse maravillado por el trabajo, Lucrezia se da cuenta de que la pintura asumir√° el que tendr√≠a que ser su papel en la vida del esposo. El amor que recorr√≠a las p√°ginas hipn√≥ticas de "Hamnet", su anterior ficci√≥n hist√≥rica, es en la √∫ltima novela de O‚ÄôFarrell amenaza constante, acecho que no ceja. Es la vida suspendida de un hilo. Ingeniosa, inventiva e ir√≥nica, incluso veraz, todo fluye en medio de un suspense lujosamente imaginado.
---
El estilo de James Salter es el√≠ptico, los detalles y las observaciones se agolpan oblicua y melodiosamente y ponen al lector sobre alerta de un vuelco en cada p√°rrafo: un giro inesperado, un gesto, una declaraci√≥n o un desenlace sorpresa. Su sintaxis elegante, esculpida con los mejores materiales, huye del coloquialismo vulgar. "Cuentos completos", el volumen que re√∫ne su obra de ficci√≥n en miniatura, es una gran oportunidad para acercarse a un autor deslumbrante.
---
Geoff Dyer (Gloucestershire, 1958) ha publicado casi una veintena libros, de ficci√≥n y no ficci√≥n, que abarcan una amplia variedad de asuntos. "Los √∫ltimos d√≠as de Roger Federer" es su contribuci√≥n crepuscular: la del escritor que se enfrenta al ocaso de su vida, consciente de que la condici√≥n para seguir creando es la incapacidad para admitir el deterioro. Entre los escritores, pintores, compositores y deportistas de esta estupenda obra figuran Jean Rhys y otros que no fueron descubiertos hasta el final de sus carreras; aquellos como Beethoven, cuyas √∫ltimas creaciones figuran entre las m√°s profundas; y los que como D. H. Lawrence y Nietzsche, cuyas etapas finales se vieron truncadas por la muerte o la locura. Est√°n los que, como Jack Kerouac, brillan en sus inicios y luego desaparecen; aquellos como Duke Ellington, que parecen desaparecer y regresar; y los que, el caso de Federer, se muestran decididos a no desaparecer e intentan volver repetidamente. Dyer se acuerda, adem√°s, de Eve Babitz o de la seductora Annie Dillard, a las que descubre tarde.
---
"M. Los √∫ltimos d√≠as de Europa", tercer volumen de la monumental obra de Antonio Scurati (N√°poles, 1969), est√° dedicado al per√≠odo 1938-1940, cuando el mundo se preparaba para la guerra y Mussolini un√≠a la suerte de Italia a la de la Alemania de Hitler. Es la cr√≥nica de lo que el propio autor describe como un momento hist√≥rico tr√°gico en el que un tirano decide, en solitario, el destino de millones de personas. Scurati utiliza la t√©cnica de reconstruir los acontecimientos en forma ficticia, atribuyendo a los protagonistas y a los actores secundarios di√°logos inventados pero plausibles, basados en los peri√≥dicos de la √©poca, el archivo y las cartas y diarios de personajes como el Duce. Siempre cuando los lectores la consideren una novela sobre la historia y no un libro de historia, el relato se vuelve legible, por momentos apasionante e induce, adem√°s, a una necesaria reflexi√≥n acerca del pasado que no deja de llamar a la puerta.
---
Reportaje √≠ntimo escrito en segunda persona, as√≠ es como el propio periodista Arcadi Espada define "Vida de Arcadio", la suma de su iniciaci√≥n a la vida: sus cuatrocientos golpes, con la democracia juvenil espa√±ola de fondo. Se trata de uno de los libros que m√°s me han entretenido en 2023, este en el que Arcadio va haciendo su vida al mismo tiempo que se hace con ella.
Cosecha de novedades y cl√°sicos redivivos
Adem√°s de nuevas obras y debutantes, 2023 nos depar√≥ tambi√©n la recuperaci√≥n de textos imprescindibles, como el "Watt" de Beckett
M. S. Su√°rez Lafuente
El que acaba fue un a√±o rico para la literatura. Abundante en nuevas obras y debutantes, y pr√≥digo en la recuperaci√≥n de textos cl√°sicos, as√≠ como notable en el n√∫mero de traducciones de obras in√©ditas en Espa√±a o simult√°neas a su aparici√≥n en la lengua de origen.
Samuel Beckett sigue siendo un polo de atracci√≥n en la literatura. Amigo y admirador de James Joyce, vivi√≥ con desgarro la dif√≠cil vida cultural de Irlanda y las guerras europeas, circunstancias que impregnan su obra convertidas en la dificultad de la comunicaci√≥n interpersonal, la vaguedad de las palabras y la imposibilidad de conocer a quienes nos rodean. "Watt", su segunda novela, publicada en 1953, ha sido traducida por Jos√© Francisco Fern√°ndez, especialista en el dramaturgo irland√©s, con una introducci√≥n que ayuda a penetrar en las dificultades del lenguaje de Beckett y en los entresijos del cerebro de Watt, el protagonista. No hay una trama en Watt, sino un mundo interior que no obedece a leyes l√≥gicas, el narrador desconoce mucho y olvida mucho m√°s y, as√≠, abre temas, menciona personajes y nos obliga a pensar, repensar y enzarzarnos en nuestras propias incertidumbres.
Un caso diferente es la novela "Orlanda", publicada en 1999, de la autora belga Jacqueline Harpman (1929-2012), que recoge el testigo del "Orlando" que Virginia Woolf escribi√≥ en 1928 para Vita Sackville-West. Woolf rompe los esquemas temporales y Orlando se pasea con naturalidad a trav√©s de varios siglos y admite sin sorprenderse que se acuesta hombre y despierta mujer. Animada por la lectura de la novela de Woolf, Aline, la Orlanda de Harpman, crea para su uso personal un alter-ego m√°s atractivo, m√°s audaz y mucho m√°s divertido que ella, y se lanza a un viaje hacia lo desconocido, atra√≠da por su propio yo masculino, y sin m√°s cortapisas que las que le pueda poner su propia imaginaci√≥n. La autora fue psicoanalista antes de dedicarse por entero a la literatura y su conocimiento de la mente humana se transfiere a la nueva personalidad que adquiere Aline.
En octubre se estren√≥ "La contadora de pel√≠culas", dirigida por Lone Scherfig, un film basado en la novela hom√≥nima del autor chileno Hern√°n Rivera Letelier. No voy a compararlos, s√≥lo quiero decir que ver la pel√≠cula no excluye el placer de leer la novela. Como el propio t√≠tulo indica, trata de una ni√±a que va al cine y luego cuenta la pel√≠cula en el sal√≥n de su casa, ante la imposibilidad de pagar entradas para todos. La novela est√° magistralmente construida y narrada, con el n√∫mero adecuado de palabras y con la frescura que puede tener una narradora precoz en uno de los campamentos salitreros del norte de Chile. Cuando pasa el tiempo, los miembros de la familia se dispersan buscando su vida y la contadora de pel√≠culas pierde su funci√≥n, pero la novela a√∫n nos guarda una √∫ltima y sobrecogedora sorpresa.
Por si les pas√≥ desapercibida, quiero incidir en otra gran novela breve, √©sta de la autora argentina Mariana Travacio. El t√≠tulo, "Quebrada", se refiere al nombre que se da a un paso estrecho entre monta√±as y, adem√°s de la riqueza pl√°stica con que Travacio describe ese paisaje, la palabra nos vale tambi√©n como met√°fora de la vida de los tres personajes principales; vidas que, a pesar de su parentesco, padre, madre e hijo, transcurren aisladas, como divididas por un valle infranqueable. Cada personaje lleva a cabo un viaje √©pico y sobrio para superar el abismo, su √∫nica br√∫jula es bajar de la monta√±a hasta encontrar el arroyo, seguir el arroyo hasta que √©ste muera en el r√≠o y seguir luego el r√≠o para poder contemplar el mar.
No se puede concluir 2023 sin recordar a la poeta y ensayista Louise Gl√ºck, que public√≥ una interesant√≠sima novela, "Marigold y Rose", en la primavera de este a√±o, y cuya muerte el pasado octubre pas√≥ desapercibida a pesar del Nobel de Literatura que le fue concedido en 2020. La Editorial Visor public√≥ hace unos meses sus "Ensayos completos", que pueden consolarnos de su ausencia.
Reunidas y completas
De regresos y desapariciones y de libros compilatorios: poes√≠a de 2023
Luis Mu√±iz
En lo que a poes√≠a se refiere, el a√±o que ya termina ha sido pr√≥digo en ediciones de libros compilatorios, am√©n de se√±alar el regreso de poetas ausentes del ejercicio durante a√±os y ‚Äìtodo lo contrario‚Äì el final de exitosas y bien difundidas trayectorias po√©ticas. El primero es el caso de Carlos Marzal, quien, con las 250 p√°ginas de "Euforia" (Tusquets), vuelve a publicar tras casi tres lustros de silencio (de ah√≠, seguramente, la extensi√≥n); el segundo, el de Jos√© Luis Rey, que dice haber echado el cierre a su poes√≠a con "El dorado" (Visor) reci√©n cumplidos los 50 a√±os.
Miguel Casado y Andr√©s S√°nchez Robayna, Pedro Provencio y Francisco Ferrer Ler√≠n. Los cuatro han publicado durante el a√±o su poes√≠a reunida o completa.
